result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider appeared by video.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan appeared by video for Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider.  Attorney Tristan Bednarek appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a DPA hearing. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider appeared by video.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan appeared by video for Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defendant may be eligible for a DPA. Defense counsel requests a DPA hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials, but need additional time to review with client. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference date to Br 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
stipulation and order for substitution of attorney, filed.

Defendant Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Parties provide an update to the Court regarding the no contact order. Court takes no action. Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests the no contact order be modified. Arguments heard. Court takes the request under advisement and sets the matter over for a new date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel requests a bail/bond hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. May possess tools as needed for employment.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 03/11/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CAD except through Our Family Wizard.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
